content.description: 60 right of ‘Sunshine’ is another great route that starts at a roof with a thin crack in a roof above. Climb the lower slab to a right-facing arete. Once your reach the roof traverse right along the large block. Climb the thin finger crack to a rappel cedar.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: Climb up the thin, vertical crack o the right side of the lower slab toward the double cracks in the roof above. Climb left to the rappel tree.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: This route starts 8 feet right of ‘Real World’. Climb the slab up to the right-facing dihedral I the roof. Same traverse to the right to a rappel tree.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: This route starts 10 feet right of ‘Crayola Crack’. Climb the blank slabt o the large roof by the right-facing dihedral. Traverse right to the rappel pine.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: This route starts 12 feet right of ‘Real World’. Follow the black slab through the tiered roof system above working your way right past a horizontal crack. Traverse right to the rappel tree.
Start by climbing up the far-left side of the slab and up through the double cracks above. Traverse right to a rappel pine tree.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: Continue uphill and around the corner for another 80 feet past the ‘Pray for Death Wall’. Its slab is split by a roof. On the left side of the slab is a right-facing arete. There’s a Class IV scramble up to the top ledges.
